column20: Ladies’ Night (women only, Tuesday Evenings 6:00 – 8:00 PM)
column31: What would you bring to the Bike Project? Any specific skills, hobbies or activities that could help us? If  you’re good at wrenching, that’s great, but we do need more than bicycle skills. Are you a natural  teacher? Good with computers? Can you carve excellent figurines from soap? Tell us here. Non-  mechanical skills are equally important and useful for RBP, so please list those.
column32: Have you worked with other groups in the past? Awesome. Tell us about it. What experiences do you have  working as a volunteer? If not, why do you want to volunteer with us? What do you hope to get out of your experience here?

column22: Given the opportunity I'd love to volunteer 2-3 days each week in the morning. Initially this will be just for the summer but, given the right fit, could be extended indefinitely.
column30: If you have website, computer networking, or computer repair needs, I am glad to offer my services in these areas.
column31: I'm 52 years old. I commute to work almost all yer round by bike. I'm self taught at bicycle repair. I am currently a high school math and science teacher. I am a certified computer network engineer with several other industry certifications (hardware, software, networking, wireless, etc.). I have been a manager of up to 50 people in retail, government, and military environments. I am very personable, have great people skills, am very meticulous, and organized.
column32: I have never volunteered for more than an event here and there. As a teacher for WCSD, I am looking to volunteer opportunities over the summer for a cause that I believe in. As an avid cyclist I would love the chance to serve the community in this area and I believe in the work that RBP does.
